page.title: 17COWSLIP FARM
page.content: Owner Alfred Leslie Tyrrell. Owned farm for 42 years. His wife's family farmed there since 1909. Total of 130 acres 70 for wheat, 50 for barley rest for pasture. Farmhouse built in 1553 not known if in first Domesday Book. First dairy in area to deliver milk in bottles. Supplies Witnesham, Tuddenham, Westerfield, Swilland, Ashbocking & Helmingham. Milk now brought in by tanker because farm no longer has dairy herd. Employs 2 part-time men on farm but was originally 6 to 8 men. 1980's - because of science crops are heavier heavier and get heavier each year. Its is too efficient now. Holiday accomodation and small industries on site - see under Tourism and Industry.
